metadata.feature_description: Retrieve and manage URL management options including locales, status codes, and site aliases

steps.action: Navigate to Content > Pages > Home > Advanced > S.E.O. tab
steps.expected: Page URL settings should display with locale options
steps.actual: Page S.E.O. settings displayed with URL management section

steps.action: Click Add URL button and inspect Site Alias dropdown
steps.expected: Site aliases should include locale-specific aliases
steps.actual: Site aliases dropdown showed 6 locale-specific aliases: localhost:8081, localhost:8081/en-us, localhost:8081/es-ar, localhost:8081/fr-fr, localhost:8081/de-de, localhost:8081/ar-er

steps.action: Click Add URL button on Page S.E.O. settings
steps.expected: Add URL form should appear with URL Type dropdown
steps.actual: Add URL form appeared with Site Alias, URL Path, and URL Type fields

steps.action: Click URL Type dropdown to view status codes
steps.expected: Dropdown should show supported status codes
steps.actual: Dropdown displayed two status codes: Active (200) and Redirect (301)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Retrieve site aliases and primary alias

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Site Settings > Site Behavior > Site Aliases tab
steps.expected: Site aliases list should display with primary alias identification
steps.actual: Site Aliases tab showed all 6 aliases with columns: ALIAS, BROWSER, THEME, LANGUAGE, PRIMARY. All aliases had checkmarks in PRIMARY column indicating they are marked as primary for their respective languages

steps.expected: Primary aliases should be clearly marked
steps.actual: Primary column shows checkmarks for all locale aliases - localhost:8081 (default), localhost:8081/en-us (en-US), localhost:8081/es-ar (es-AR), localhost:8081/fr-fr (fr-FR), localhost:8081/de-de (de-DE), localhost:8081/ar-er (ar-ER)

steps.action: View URL MAPPING section in Site Aliases tab
steps.expected: Site alias mapping/usage options should be available
steps.actual: URL MAPPING section displayed with Site Alias Mapping Mode options: Canonical (selected), Redirect, and None

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify correct locale configuration with multi-locale setup

steps.action: Observe locale flags in header and site alias configuration
steps.expected: Multiple locales should be configured and visible
steps.actual: Multi-locale setup confirmed with 5 locales: English (United States), Español (Argentina), Français (France), Deutsch (Deutschland), العربية (إريتريا). Each has a corresponding site alias configured.

steps.action: Verify Site Aliases table matches locale configuration
steps.expected: Each locale should have a corresponding site alias
steps.actual: All 5 locales have matching site aliases with proper language codes: en-US, es-AR, fr-FR, de-DE, ar-ER

observations: The GetUrlOptions endpoint returns Locales, StatusCodes, SiteAliases, PrimaryAliasId, and SiteAliasUsages as confirmed by code review of UrlManagementServiceController.cs
Site aliases are displayed with locale-specific URL paths (e.g., localhost:8081/en-us for English)
Status codes are limited to two options: Active (200) for primary URLs and Redirect (301) for redirecting URLs
Site Alias Mapping Mode provides three usage options: Canonical, Redirect, and None for controlling how site aliases behave
The multi-locale setup supports 5 languages plus a default site alias without language code
